results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS

results.title: Freely given
results.brief_description: “This instrument may be freely given, never bought or sold” says violin maker John Godschall Johnson as we see him carving and shaping a beautifully handcrafted violin into its final form.

results.title: Turn me on: the history of the vibrator
results.creator_credit: Warwick Burton, Catherine Chauchat and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Turn Me On explores the history of the vibrator. Through a group of sexpert characters, the documentary uncovers the socially camouflaged sex toy - hidden in the underwear drawer since it was invented over 120 years ago. Turn Me On reveals a social and sexual history that some people would prefer remained a secret.
results.title_for_label: Turn me on: the history of the vibrator
results.description: Turn Me On explores the history of the vibrator. results.title: Sammy Blue
results.creator_credit: Isabel Perez, Kim Farrant and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Sammy Blue is a young boy who wants to escape from the white noise of reality in his everyday life. If only he could be just like his goldfish “Blue” and swim around the bowl – forgetting everything, living moment by moment.
Features Andrew S. Gilbert as father, Claire Paradine as mother, William Balmford as Sammy and Zoe Carides as Mary.

results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Tim Kreibig and Anna Fraser

results.title: Joy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Rachel Clements and Cate Shortland
results.brief_description:
Thursday night. Late night shopping. Joy wants to have fun. This film follows a teenage girl as she hits the town in search of a good time. But Joy’s search for fulfillment leaves her lost and lonely at the end of the evening as we follow her to her unhappy home. By the director of ‘Somersault’ (2004). Original format 35mm/colour.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may offend some viewers.
